p: Individual compounds (i.e., hydroxytyrosol, maslinic acid, oleocanthal, oleacein, and oleuropein) from O. europaea extracts have been tested against P. gingivalis and other oral pathogens including Streptococcus mutans, Streptococcus sobrinus, Streptococcus oralis, Fusobacterium nucleatum and Parvimonas micra. Overall, it is likely that maslinic acid and olaecein are responsible for most of the antibacterial activity [ 64].
